thread.title: Aggies yield 507 rushing yards, lose to Ga. Southern
thread.title_full: Aggies yield 507 rushing yards, lose to Ga. Southern | Albuquerque Journal News

author: Randy Harrison / Journal Sports Editor
title: Aggies yield 507 rushing yards, lose to Ga. Southern
text:
Georgia Southern linebacker Antoine Williams tackles New Mexico State’s Royce Caldwell during the Aggies’ 56-26 Sun Belt Conference football loss on Saturday in Statesboro, Ga. (Josh Galemore/Savannah Morning News via AP)
STATESBORO, Ga. — The Georgia Southern Eagles started with a rush and never really let up in Saturday’s 56-26 football victory over visiting New Mexico State.
Matt Breida ran for 137 yards and touchdown on 13 carries, quarterback Kevin Ellison added a 67-yard TD sprint, and Georgia State (5-1, 3-0 Sun Belt Conference) amassed 507 rushing yards on 59 carries.
The Eagles took control with four lengthy touchdown runs in the first half, building a 28-0 lead on L.A. Ramsby’s 23-yard rush with 2:46 left in the first half.
New Mexico State (0-6, 0-2) got three touchdown passes from quarterback Andrew Allen, who made his first start of the season in place of injured Tyler Rogers. Allen finished 20-of-37 passing for 253 yards and threw one interception.
Allen moved the offense reasonably well over the final three quarters but the Aggies never got closer than a 21-point deficit after their sluggish start. NMSU lost its 16th consecutive game dating back to last season, the longest active skid among FBS teams.
Georgia Southern was coming off a bye week and won its fifth straight game by an impressive margin. It has averaged 48.2 points per game during that span.
The Eagles’ triple-option attack also came in leading the nation in rushing at 377.4 yards per game and significantly increased its average.
Wesley Fields also pulled in a 60-yard scoring pass from Ellison as Georgia Southern led by as many as 44 points in the fourth quarter. It was the first passing touchdown for the Eagles in more than a year. They passed for just 85 yards Saturday but did not need to go to the air often.
Ellison became the sixth Georgia Southern player to exceed 2,000 career yards rushing and passing.
For NMSU, Larry Rose III rushed 13 times for 82 yards and caught five passes for 31 more. Manzano High School graduate Joshua Bowen caught two short touchdown passes for the Aggies, and Jordan Bergstrom caught three passes for 46 yards and a TD.
The Aggies’ final points came on a 74-yard fumble return by lineback Will Clement with 6:43 left in the game.
Three linebackers were ejected for targeting: Eagles Deshawntee “Ironhead” Gallon and William Bussey and Aggie Terrill Hanks.
Box score: Georgia Southern 56, New Mexico State 26
